intro: Leptolobium lanceolatum, commonly known as the narrow-leafed lomatium, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, characterized by its aromatic foliage and umbellate inflorescences. The plant features finely dissected, lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in a dense layer of fine hairs. Its small, yellowish-white flowers bloom in late spring, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. The plant is typically found in dry, open habitats like grasslands and rocky slopes.
